title: (x) Help with identifying this swash - hand-drawn by Herb Lubalin {Riccardo}
content:
It seems this is similar to Caslon Swash.  
Any better/closer guesses?

Many thanks!

-Julia

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [swiss-graphic-design-142.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20100313052316/http:/typophile.com/files/swiss-graphic-design-142.jpg) | 113.25 KB |
author: juree83

comments.content: This is work by [Herb Lubalin](http://web.archive.org/web/20100313052316/http:/images.google.com/images?client=safari&rls=en&q=herb+lubalin&oe=UTF-8&um=1&ie=UTF-8&ei=9KWZS630A4PkNN_1nXo&sa=X&oi=image_result_group&ct=title&resnum=1&ved=0CBkQsAQwAA), and as such, it was probably hand-drawn... Made specifically for that ad, which appears to be promoting his studio.

Don't know if it's closer but a good base font would have been Cheltenham Italic SC w swashes... Don't think it exists though... You could also consider Bookman SC Italic Swash(?) or LTC Caslon (for swashes)  
- [ITC Cheltenham Italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20100313052316/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/cheltenham/book-italic/)  
- [Paul D. Hunt's work](http://web.archive.org/web/20100313052316/http:/1.academy.typophile.com/node/17528)  
- [LTC Caslon](http://web.archive.org/web/20100313052316/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/lanston/ltc-caslon/)  
- [LET Caslon Italic w Swashes](http://web.archive.org/web/20100313052316/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/letraset/caslon-italic-with-swashes/italic-with-swashes/)  
- Adobe Caslon Pro  
- [ITC Bookman Swash](http://web.archive.org/web/20100313052316/http:/www.fonts.com/FindFonts/detail.htm?pid=415684)  
- [Jukebox Bookman](http://web.archive.org/web/20100313052316/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=JBT0000085)  
- [ITC Bookman Complete](http://web.archive.org/web/20100313052316/http:/www.fonts.com/FindFonts/detail.htm?pid=44276)
